title: JavamoduleKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about JavamoduleKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Declare a module:
module mymodule {
}
Definition and Usage
The
module
keyword is used to declare a module. Following the keyword is the name of the module and braces which can contain directives describing the module.
Note:
The
module
keyword is meant to be used in the
module-info.java
file of a module.
The
module
keyword was new in Java 9.

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Implement a Function
practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: Java Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

module
keyword?
options: the name of the module and braces which can contain directives describing the module

The
module

quiz.question: What is Following the keyword?
options: the name of the module and braces which can contain directives describing the module
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Following the keyword is 'the name of the module and braces which can contain directives describing the module'.

summary: This tutorial covers JavamoduleKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavamoduleKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavamoduleKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
